Also, T. albicans revealed higher essential oil yield than other widely marketed thyme species like Thymus vulgaris L., Thymus zygis L. and T. mastichina. It is important to underline that although T. albicans and T. mastichina are both species of the Mastichina section with high content of 1,8-cineole, only T. mastichina oil has industrial relevance, proven by the established ISO 4728:2003 standard
15 . Indeed, the bioactivities herein reported confirm the potential of T. albicans essential oil paving the way for further studies on the pharmaceutical applications of this species, which might contribute to improve its conservation status.
